meaningMnemonic: Remember how 手 can mean "doer" in some words? Well this is one of them. In sports, you must <kanji>choose</kanji> the best <kanji>doer</kanji> for your team. In the world of sports, these "chosen doers" are the  <vocabulary>pro athlete</vocabulary>s and  <vocabulary>sports player </vocabulary>s.
readingMnemonic: The reading for 選 is what you'd expect. 手 is the on'yomi reading as it is every once in a while, especially when it has to do with representing a person, so you'll have to remember that. I think you've seen 手 using this reading enough to be able to remember it, though.
